summary: This is a sealed federal indictment from the Southern District of New York charging Ghislaine Maxwell with six counts related to the sexual exploitation of minors. The indictment alleges Maxwell conspired with Jeffrey Epstein from 1994-1997 to recruit, groom, and transport underage girls for sexual abuse at multiple properties, and that she committed perjury during a 2016 civil deposition.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Charged with conspiracy, enticement, transportation of minors, and perjury for her alleged role in facilitating Jeffrey Epstein's sexual abuse of minor girls.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Described as the primary abuser of minor girls, with Maxwell allegedly assisting him in recruiting, grooming, and abusing victims as young as 14.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: Signed the indictment as the Acting U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York.

connections.description: Alleged co-conspirators in a scheme to entice and transport minors for sexual abuse. Had a personal and professional relationship; Maxwell was paid to manage Epstein's properties and was among his closest associates.
Maxwell is alleged to have facilitated Epstein's access to minor victims, knowing he had a sexual preference for underage girls and intended to abuse them.

events.title: Conspiracy and Abuse Period
events.description: Maxwell and Epstein allegedly conspired to recruit, groom, and sexually abuse multiple minor girls at various residences.

events.title: Minor Victim-1 Travel from Florida to New York
events.description: Minor Victim-1 was enticed to travel from Florida to New York for the purpose of being sexually abused at Epstein's New York residence.

events.title: Massage of Minor Victim-2 in New Mexico
events.description: Maxwell provided an unsolicited massage to Minor Victim-2 in New Mexico, during which the victim was topless, as part of grooming for abuse by Epstein.

events.title: Grooming of Minor Victim-3 in London
events.description: Maxwell groomed and befriended Minor Victim-3 in London, introduced her to Epstein, and encouraged her to massage him, knowing it would lead to sexual abuse.

events.title: First Perjurious Deposition
events.description: During a civil deposition, Maxwell falsely testified she was unaware of any scheme by Epstein to recruit underage girls for sexual massages and denied interacting with anyone under 18 other than the plaintiff.

events.title: Second Perjurious Deposition
events.description: During a civil deposition, Maxwell falsely testified about her awareness of sex toys at Epstein's home, her knowledge of his sexual activities with others, and denied ever giving massages to Epstein or Minor Victim-2.

locations: Upper East Side, Manhattan, New York (Epstein's New York Residence)
Palm Beach, Florida (Epstein's Palm Beach Residence)
Santa Fe, New Mexico (Epstein's New Mexico Ranch)
Southern District of New York (jurisdiction for the indictment)
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell is charged with six federal counts: conspiracy to entice minors, enticement of a minor, conspiracy to transport minors, transportation of a minor, and two counts of perjury.
The indictment alleges Maxwell and Epstein's abuse scheme targeted girls as young as 14 years old from approximately 1994 to 1997.
Maxwell is accused of normalizing sexual abuse for victims by discussing sexual topics, undressing in front of them, and being present for sex acts with Epstein.
The indictment details specific grooming and abuse of three minor victims (identified as Minor Victim-1, -2, and -3) at properties in New York, Florida, New Mexico, and London.
Maxwell is charged with perjury for false statements made under oath in 2016, including denying knowledge of Epstein's scheme and denying she gave massages.
